version_description:
- Optional iOS7+ flat user interface style with more vibrant colors and light background (Display menu).

- Extra color set for the visualization of the taps (Tapping menu).â€¨

- iOS 9 adjustments.

- Fix for a problem with the stereo sound option.
- iOS 9.3.3 tested.

Minor improvements and fixes.
iOS 10 tested.

- Whole rest added to Modify menu.
- Option in Display menu to force the screen orientation to landscape (iPhone only, for iPad use the side switch or the orientation icon in the Control Center).

- Performance improvements.
- iOS 10.1 adjustments.

- Option in the Microphone menu to always use the built in microphone (e.g. instead of the microphone of a headset).
- Minor fixes and improvements.
Fixes an issue with stopping the metronome manually.
- Improved interrupt handling (incoming calls, changes in audio equipment etc.)

- iOS 10.2 tested.
- Fix for left-handed tapping.

- More battery friendly.
- Latency reduction with high speed exercises ( > 400 taps per minute).

- A frequency chart of the tap results is shown after a test, providing a summary of the timing accuracy. The Tapping menu of settings has some text layout options for the chart, especially useful for smaller devices. The chart is also attached to the 100% score mail.
- Performance improvement: max input tempo increased to 8 taps per second (10/sec for microphone input).

- Microphone sensitivity adjustments to better support external microphones.
- Sound updates for some percussive instruments.
- Minor bug fixes.
- iOS 10.3.2 tested.

- 32nd notes in new 3/8 random level.

- 32nd note patterns added to the rhythm editor for 3/8, 6/8 exercises.

- In the editor, patterns longer than one beat have a small time signature to make them easier to recognize.

- Some textual corrections.
- Max number of favorites that can be stored on the iOS device increased to 200.
- iOS 10.3.3 tested.
- Textual adjustments and minor bug fixes.

- iOS 11 adjustments (also valid for iOS 9, 10).
- Larger buttons in sound menu for easier selection.

- The Microphone menu has a selection list of currently attached audio input devices. Use this list to choose a specific (external) microphone or instrument input.

- iPhone X ready.

- Final adjustments for iPhone X.
- Minor bug fixes.

- Some performance enhancements for older devices.
- Minor bug fixes.

- Added some fixed exercises for 32nd notes.
- Improved readability of help screens by using a variable font and image size, based on the device size.

- Clear button in the Modify exercise screen, to quickly remove all notes.

- Quick start tutorial for new users. Can also be started via Settings / Support.
Support for older devices with iOS 9.3.
- Native screen resolution support for iPhone XS and XS Max.

Added the possibility to let the metronome sound on specific beats of each bar. These settings are saved per time signature. E.g. select only beat 1 to do a fast 3/4 exercise or select beats 2 & 4 in a 4/4 exercise, a well known metronome challenge in contemporary music. Option can be found in the first item of the metronome menu.
- User interface adjustments for the new 11-inch iPad Pro and 12.9-inch iPad Pro (3rd generation).

- Some textual adjustments in the quick start tutorial.
- Minor bug fixes.
Minor corrections and improvements.
Four 12/8 random levels.

- 32 bit compatibility restored (for older devices).
- Extra challenge function Tap the beat and rhythm now has a customisable beat sound, see Sounds of second tap button in Tapping menu.
- Extra button in the editor to add a bar (if screen space permits).
- Minor improvements and a few bug fixes.

- Three 3/2 random levels.
- Pass-through microphone audio option. With this option, the tap sounds of the app itself are muted and you hear your own (slightly amplified) sounds. E.g. useful for doing exercises with a drum practice pad and drumsticks.
After completion of an endurance or speeding up test, the results of all completed exercises are listed in the mail-report. High-accuracy results are colored green.

Extra exercise progress indicator:

- With accurate results and exercise played at least three times, the indicator changes to a light green square.

- Accurate is defined as: minimum deviation equals 0, max deviation 0.03 sec or less and average deviation 0.01 sec or less.

- Two progress indicators are now shown, one corresponding to the best total time deviation (top left corner of the screen) and one for the current test results.
- Minor user interface improvements plus some bug fixes.
- Performance improvements.
- Textual adjustments.

- Fix for font size problem in help files on some devices.
- Minor other corrections and improvements.
Dark mode support (iOS 13 required). For printing purposes, the attachment of the 100% score mail is always in the light interface style.

- Fix for problem with importing exercises.
- iOS & iPadOS 13.1.3 tested.

- Three dark mode options: match system, always off, always on.
- Options can be found in Display menu of settings (4th line).
- Default: match system.
- Minor dark mode corrections and textual changes.
